user_review: Oh myyy ate 2 crepes buckwheat with egg and ham and another one salted caramel with dark chocolate .Buckwheat creape was perfect with crispy sides and more than perfect centre ..soft not soggy.The egg was just right with its sunnyness,a bit runny and the bottom lightly cooked.HamCramel crepe...best butter caramel.with exact balance of butterness and salt.dark chocolate was the best friend cutting the bare saltyness to mild bitterness .

You can't go wrong with Breizh Café. As a Frenchwoman, I always appreciate an authentic creperie, and this one, on top of being conveniently located in the heart of the Plateau Mont-Royal, is also exquisite. The food is both simple and incredibly tasty - you can technically customize a salted butter buckwheat crepe with a select range of ingredients, such as leek, swiss cheese and maple syrup. The ready-made crepes range from the ubiquitous cheese and ham to the more complex smoked salmon and dill cream. And their sweet crepes are equally delicious - I personally recommend the lemon and sugar crepe. On top of the menu they also have ready-made brunches for every palate. Last but not least, the service is friendly and efficient. They're genuinely lovely, professional people and will go above and beyond to ensure a great culinary experience. High marks all around!

What a delight full little restaurant on st Laurent.If you're craving crepes like I was yesturday than look no further you have found THE crepe place to be. They have a great selection of crepes ranging from sweet to salty.Saturday afternoon is when I decided to check out this great location. I had a feeling it would be busy so I called 30 minutes ahead of time to reserve a table. Upon arrival I was greeted by a very smiley red head woman with great glasses ! The place was pretty busy but it wasn't loud like most other breakfast joints so that was great because I don't like yelling over others just to ask how someone's day is.I was having trouble picking since there were so many possibilities but finally I decided on the québécois which consisted of apples bacon and Swiss cheese. Mmmm ! What a great crepe that was it was exactly what I was looking for, my cravings were met. I suggest this location to anyone who's big on crepes or just wanting to try something different, there's literally a crepe for everyone.

I wanted to eat a heavy carb déjeuner before climbing Mount Royal. It just so happened I passed this crêperie conveniently located on Boulevard Saint-Laurent. This cafe uses buckwheat flour for their savory crepes in the style of Brittany region of France. You can order the regular or large size crepe. I went for the grande size LA Québécoise (stuffed with cooked apples, swiss cheese, bacon, and maple syrup). Paired with a bowl of cafe au lait, it was a hearty breakfast. This is my go-to place for crepes next time I'm in Montreal.

Delicious traditional crepes!A traditional crepe restaurant on St. Laurent. The interior of the restaurant was homey, and the patio allowed you to be in the street and people watch as folks were roaming around during the Mural street festival. We stopped in here just for dessert. We tried the:1. Kir Breton -  a small flute of a creamy, fruity cider. Really bright and effervescent, a real treat. It could have been dessert on its own!2. "Le Sniker" crepe - a dessert crepe with chocolate and caramel, topped with ice cream. The crepe was crispy and thin, and the filling was nice and sweet.The experience overall was good; we're glad we tried it, though perhaps we aren't crepe people and weren't wowwed. The restaurant has an extensive menu of sweet and savory options that were very reasonably priced. We would come back to try some more options. Service was friendly enough!--Rating Rubric--5* - As good as it gets; goes above and beyond. I would come here again and again!4* - Worth checking out; a good value. No major complaints or only minor flaws that set this place back. I'm glad I tried it, but I might not come back here in lieu of trying somewhere new.3* - A few setbacks that soured the experience. Not the worst, but I wouldn't recommend it to friends.2* - Multiple setbacks that made me dislike the place.1* - I was personally offended by the people or services. Steer clear!

This is probably my favorite cafe in Montreal so far. FOODAll the crepes are thin and well done with a chewy texture and a nice crisp. I got to try a couple from the menu during my 2 visits. My personal favorites are as follow:Meal - La Parisienne (ham, Swiss cheese, bechemel sauce, mushrooms) - the melted Swiss cheese and bechemel sauce inside the warm close phased crepe give a creamy texture.Dessert - Caramel Au Beurre Sale (salted caramel butter) - the crepe is not overly sweet due to the combination of caramel and salted butter. Sweetness is just right for my personal preference.If you are craving for both salty and sweet crepes, La Quebecoise (cooked apple, bacon, Swiss cheese, maple syrup) is not a bad choice either! AMBIENCEThe environment was quite nice with some soft background music. Two of the tables are close to the glass sliding doors, which are opened during the day. You can enjoy some sunlight if the weather is nice. STAFFThe servers are all very polite and friendly. My family and I visited here 2 days in a row. On our first night, the server was considerate and told us right away when we entered the cafe that the card machine was not working before we were seated. My mom and I were looking for the washroom after our meal and the server told us immediately before we even asked. PRICE Price is reasonable. Crepes range from $5 to $19 before tax (from very plain to ones with scallop and salmon). A person would spend on average $15 including tips and tax (assuming you're getting a classic crepe with protein and a cup of regular coffee).

The staff were very friendly and prompt. I was so excited to see a galette restaurant -- we do not have them in the US so I haven't had a proper galette since I studied in Rennes. Overall it was very good -- I got the smoked salmon one. I love smoked salmon, but I think they put a little bit too much in - the flavor was very overwhelming. I would probably go back and just order something else. Overall it was a nice experience!
I love crepes. Especially salted caramel & caramelised apples. This place has that. I love this place.

I've only had crepes probably less than a handful number of times. They're often soggy and dense where I'm from in the U.S. so I'm always a bit hesitant to order them. However, when we crossed the border into Québec, I made it a mission to eat as many as I can. Now that I'm back home, I'm totally screwed since I now get frequent cravings and can't get anything remotely close to these amazingly crisp, warm, delicious (and relatively inexpensive) crepes. I had 2 savory crepes, and one sweet one (mind you this was only breakfast) and I can't begin to describe how good they are. The buckwheat crepes are very different to what I'm used to; very mild in flavor, crisp, and light. The filling to crepe ratio was perfect. The dessert hazelnut crepe was also the bomb; brilliant play on textures. & of course I had to add ice cream.Interior was very modern and hip. Breizh is perfect for dates and mingling and the service was fantastic. Great coffee as well; highly recommend the visit!
Amazing service , amazing food , place is cozy and nice , vegetarian options !!! Over all GREAT !

Food was hot and super tasty. The server was from Paris and extremely friendly. We even got up to watch the crepe master in action. All crepes were made out of buckwheat flour which made them gluten free and extra delicious!  For dessert we had a sweet crepe with home made caramel and it was to die for! Would recommend their crepes to anyone!

Came here with a group of 10 with reservation and they were very accommodating. They waited until everyone arrived and all our orders came pretty altogether considering they only have like 3 crepe skillets. Food was great, I ordered the one with egg, goat cheese and creamed leeks and it was super tasty! The goat cheese was strong but not too much, creamed leek was the best part. I liked dipping each of my pieces into the yolk. However considering the prices the portion could be more. I also ordered the far breton dessert, which is a flan cake with raisin-like pieces. It was different but still good, it was my first time having real flan cake so I don't have a good reference :P This is definitely a place I'd bring people to!

Ok, if you want crepes that taste like the ones you had in Brittany, you go here.  This place is awesome and as authentic as it gets!  Crepes Saracins (buckwheat) for the salty ones, and classic dough for the sweets is hard to find as most places just use the classic (white wheat) dough for both... All the Breton assortments here in a great casual environment...A+

Very nice service, the waiters are great the food is great ! Coming from Brittany myself I recommend their crepes and galettes they are the same as in France ! Love them!Wish they had a raclette galette though !

Everything was great here from food to the service. The savory crepes are made with buckwheat and the combination of ingredients is quite tasty. The sweet crepes are made with regular flour and equally if not more delicious. Very nice ambiance and along a great section on Saint-Laurent. I will definitely back.

Great presentation of crepes, solid hot chocolate as well. They have a section of crêpes with alcohol that my wife wasn't too sure of. Bitter brandy with sweet orange marmalade crêpe didnt go that well. I had madam helene and it was good too. The cafe soon had a line of people out on the street, not sure if I'd wait 30-60mins for food here

Our group ordered the Le Breton lunch and the brunch salmon crepe option. Both fresh, delicious, tasty. Our group call to reserve a table for 11 and we were greated promptly and nicely by Benedict. Prices are very reasonably.

I came here on a Sunday and was seated right away. Had their 3 course meal to share with a friend for about $35 after tax and tip. The food was served quickly, and the waitress was very attentive and friendly. My friend loved the french onion soup and wanted to order a second bowl. The crepe isn't as sweet as other places but I enjoyed it nonetheless.

Service: very friendly and helpful. There are several choices in the menu and looked yummy and our waitress was very kind to recommend the popular choices in galettes and crepes. Food: stars of the night - we got the galette with feta, leek, egg and caramelised onion and also the caramelised Apple crepe, both recommended by the waitress. The galette was crispy and very tasty, the crepe was soft and right amount of sweetness. Both my wife and I cleaned up our plates!Overall, great place in a lively neighbourhood, very good food and friendly.. we wanted to come back again! Next time we travel to Montreal!

I went here with a couple friends for brunch this Sunday. All I can say is awesome!! Immediately when we walked in we were happily greeted by the hostess and given a table. The atmosphere was great, and my French friends said it reminded her of some small family owned French cafe's she used to go to. In regards to our food, everything was amazing! I ordered Le Breton combo. The galette with egg, ham, and Swiss was delicious and very filling, a good size for the price especially considering it came with fresh fruit, great coffee, a sample of their homemade mango-banana-strawberry juice, and a dried plum pudding cake for dessert.Really excellent, food, service, and atmosphere! All around just a perfect experience!
We were in Montreal for just 5 days and we went to Breizh 3 times. Their savory crepes are amazing. I wish they had crepes like this in the US.

Beautiful delicious buckwheat crepes! I'm so impressed and I've had plenty in Paris. Charming service and space, definitely recommend if you're in MTL. I will definitely try to make a visit whenever I'm here from now on.

We went to this cafe based on reviews and loved it so much we ended up coming back. Had dessert crepes first time- crepe Suzette, chocolate crepe and Snickers crepe. All were outstanding as was their cappuccino. Service was impeccable, the waitress was very friendly and efficient. The second time around I wanted to try a savory crepe while the family went for sweet ones again. I ordered a large (grande) Nordic crepe with smoked salmon, Swiss cheese, spinach and dill cream on top. It was huge, stuffed to the brim and absolutely delicious. Everyone tried it and loved it. Again service was impeccable. If you're visiting Montreal looking to try authentic great crepes you should give this place a chance, you won't regret it.

The food and the waitress was very warm and attentive. The food was pretty good and a fair value for what you get. We did the set fixed menu option and It was $72 CAD after tax and tip for a three course meal for two.

They must have been having a bad day in the kitchen when we visited. Our crepes were overlooked and my wife's was tasteless. I didn't believe her until I tasted it myself. Service was excellent. We picked this from Yelp because it had so many great reviews. I don't think we will return.
Delicious unpretentious crêpes, masterfully executed. Great service and food. Can't go wrong.

Well the food was fine. Nothing to write home about the service was horrendous. Maybe because we are American. They told us we couldn't have extra plates but there was a ginormous stack of plates. And the table next to us was brought small plates for sharing. Took over 2 hours to bring out 4 crepes. If you are American stay away....

Two of us visited Breizh Cafe and ordered the weekday lunch specials which come with tea or coffee, soup or salad, and several crepe choices. We had the "complété" (ham, Swiss, and sunny side up egg) and veggie (Swiss, onions, spinach, tomato). There were multiple tea choices. We enjoyed the soup du jour which was carrot and ginger. The crepes were great, light, and not greasy at all (which we have found at crêperies in Paris). Very happy with this place and the prices are reasonable.

Good food. Reasonably priced. We waited 30 minutes for a table. I probably would not have waited if I had to do it all over. Had the ham and Swiss to start. Good but a bit dry. Then the caramel crepe for dessert it was delicious but could have used a little more caramel!

Gluten-free buckwheat crepes! They were delicious. Nice and crispy on the outside but with a little bit of chew. Definitely different but welcomed into my tummy for sure. They use regular crepe batter for dessert. We had the chocolate banana praline and the crepe suzette. Dang, both were a slam dunk. Crepes done right, for sure!

We had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. We were touring downtown Montreal and decided to get crepes, and every place downtown was closing right at 6. We are so glad we came here instead! It's set in a more residential part of town surrounded by a lot of different food options. The coffee selection was short but delicious, and they had wine and cider options as well. The crepes (both sweet and savory) were amazing and well priced. The service was outstanding. Definitely worth a visit.

Do you like crepes? Are you ok with Buckwheat? Do you like a friendly atmosphere? Do you want a pokestop while you have breakfast?Here is your spot. The crepes are great, really well balanced and large enough to fill you up. It is odd that they come as a square, but they still are tasty. Most of the savory crepes come on a buckwheat crepe, which is different but not bad. Im sure if you asked for regular crepe stuff, they would give it to you. The dessert crepes are awesome, and I recommend getting one. You can split 2 crepes between 2 people and you would be good. Only complaints were that the coffee was a little burnt and they were pricier than my local crepe place. All in all though, I would go back here. Note: I didnt check out the shitter.

Craving for some crepe and this place totally satisfying. Crepes were so tasty and crispy. My hubby ordered the 3 course. Pork pate was ok, but his pork and leek crepe was amazing. His meal ended with a chocolate, salted caramel crepe, yes more crepe because it was just that delicious. I ordered the québécois, the mix of caramelized apples with bacon and maple syrup was well balanced. It was so good that I ordered another chestnut cream crepe to finish my meal. I love this French style crepe.
We loved it.  Delicious hot chocolae.  Crepes were perfection.   Even my 5yo eat it all and he is super picky.   Orange juice was fresh.  Excellent service!
me and my wife enjoyed " La Chevrette" and La Complete"  Crepe and wow delicious Chocolat maison crepe too, as we already now the Breton crepes in France enjoy!!!

This place was really great. The food was amazing. The coffee was great. The waitress was great. The service was very quick. I loved the whole experience from start to finish. I'm not that crazy about crepes but they do it differently at this place and I have wanted to go back ever since. Totally worth it.

Thank you Yelpers! My perfectly cooked nutella crepe with bananas hit the spot. Soft yet crispy in parts but never soggy, this buttery sweetness was exactly was I was looking for. Minus 1 star for not readily getting drinks but I'm also a NYCer with high expectations and limited patience. I'm working on it!
The food is really good but the service is really slow and unfriendly to americans. Unfortunately my friends and i have run into this quite a bit in Montreal especially at restaraunts.
This is such a cute place. Amazing service and really good crepes too. The server was so sweet and nice and I had such a good time here :)

Wow. Between the food & the service this was by far my favorite place of my trip. It was mid afternoon, it wasn't too busy. I ordered two crepes & both were delicious! The snickers crepe was my favorite, I would have preferred milk chocolate but dark chocolate was good as well. Our waiter was very friendly! We will be back!
One of the best crepes I ever had was here. Service was a bit slow (only one waitress working), but super friendly. No complaints. Would totally go back when in Montreal.

the restaurant was excellent. In fact it was so good we ended up going twice on a four day visit to Montreal. We tried a variety of different crapes and each of them was excellent. We especially liked the Québecois. Lovely people super friendly. It does get busy on the weekends so if you get a chance call ahead and make a reservation. My son especially enjoyed a crêpe called la completes Tomates. Le œuf sur le crêpe était très bon.
Carrot and cumin soup, sunny side up egg on a parisienne galette and far breton. Such a great combo for lunch! Service was fast, attentive, very pleasant. I would love to come back!

We did a sweet crepe evening for dinner and this place had high reviews.  Our expectations were met - the food was great and the service was good.  Nice quaint place for a good crepe and coffee experience.

This is in my opinion the best crêperie in Montreal. I had the table d'hôtes with the rillettes, carotte and ginger soup which were absolutely amazing. Then I had the chevrette with fresh and juicy tomatoes, amazing. Finally I had the chocolate banana Crêpes, simply the best Crêpes I've ever had. Crispy and smooth at the same time. And there espresso is very good too.

Best galettes, AND crepes, in Montreal. And so far, on this side of the Atlantic (and better than many in France). They even perfectly cook the egg sunny side up!! Service was great the first time, not so much the second time (waiter was not friendly, let us wait for ages before taking our order, even for beverage, whereas the restaurant was almost empty but for another table of 4 guys who he obviously preferred to interact with) - reason for the loss of one star.

Great galettes, beautifully made -- crispy in just the right amounts and really yummy.   What I fell in love with are the crepes though, in particular the crepe suzette.   I also really enjoyed the cider -- I even bought some home with me.  The service was great and the cafe has a great atmosphere.   I come back here every time I come to Montreal.  Amazing place.
One of my favorte creperies in Montreal. Such great food and service and you must try their far breton!

Wonderful buckwheat crepes. Both savory and sweet. Obviously better to eat on site than to go, but the latter is an option if you are in a time crunch. I stopped here a few times on my way to the Mainline Theatre. I especially enjoyed the one with goat cheese, tomatoes, and caramelized onions and the one with apple, bacon, and maple syrup.

The savory crepes were delicious! Cooked to perfection and beautifully presented. Mine had two sunny side eggs inside with yolks intact, when you slice the crepe open it smothers it with the yolk - so good. They are enormous as well, the grande version of any of the crepes, without any sides will stuff a burly man with ease. Service was excellent too, highly recommend!

I loved this place from beginning to end. We did not have a long wait and the buckwheat crepes were really really good. The sweet ones as well. We had a great time and they were accommodating to my 2 year old as well. Great experience and would go back.

After walking around in cold Montreal, we were hungry and wanted to grab a bite to eat. We had walked in front of this place and made our way back because it looked like an authentic place, plus we are also Frenchies and LOVE crepes! We were not disappointed! The crepes and French Onion soup were super yummy. The service was quick and our waitress was very friendly!

Delicious and authentic crêperie... And the place is adorable! The people working there clearly have a passion for their cuisine. They are very friendly and inviting. I went there with my boyfriend and we both had a galette and a sweet crêpe, both of which leaving our taste buds wanting more but our stomachs very satisfied. I would recommend the ham, egg and spinach galette for the main meal and the homemade berry compote crêpe for dessert! ... We will definitely be returning!
The best crepes I have ever had!! There are so many options for flavor both savory and sweet. Definitely a must try if you are in the area!!

Fairly priced and friendly service (though a bit slow, there was only one waitress).I ordered the Nordic crepe and was quite satisfied, although it was a bit dry on the edges.I am rating it 4 stars because it made me want to come back, perhaps i will try their brunch menu next time.
Fast and very friendly service. Kid friendly place with delicious crepes. Highly recommended!

These crêpes were excellent! I've had crepes in Paris at another breizh cafe and this was comparable. The buckwheat "sarrasin" was perfect - lacey and crispy without being chewy. The " Québécois " was super as was "la vege" with caramélized onions. Everything from service to the quality of the food was super here. I highly recommend this restaurant!

Service was excellent. Nice place to chill out. Ordered the midi express to share after just having breakfast twenty min agoThe la Parisienne crepe was tasty and crispy with the gluten free Buck wheat crepeSweet home made chocolate crepe tasted a little too oily thoughFree flow coffee refillsYay

DELICIOUS!!! What a lovely and delicious way to spend my last few hours in Montreal, on a rainy afternoon. I recommend the French Onion soup, vegetarian buckwheat crepe and the chocolate crepe. Relaxed atmosphere and affordable as well.
I'm eager to go back to this place, the crepes were delicious and they had a wide variety to choose from. The food was excellent but the service is so so.

The waiter was rude and unhelpful. The restaurant wasn't full and were told they could not seat a party of 3. We asked if we could get take away and he bluntly replied "no". We said we only wanted 1 crepe to take away and he again just said "no, too busy, we can't do take away." We had to prompt him as to how long the wait would be, and he reluctantly said "at least 40 mins, customers get priority. " He kept wanting to walk away and gave us the impression we were unwelcome. We won't be returning here.

Delicious brunch, we both tried the Le Canadien and weren't disappointed -- they brought a nice mixed-fruit juice to start. Excellent small side of pork and beans. Service was excellent, atmosphere is great too. Coffee good, very good cappuccino.
Very friendly staff and the crepes were tasty.  I enjoyed the cider and the creme brulee was legit.
Great food and attentive service. I ordered the Nordic crepe and it was delicious. The waiter did a good job throughout.

I have tried a lot of creperies in Montreal and this one is absolutely the best! The crepes are cooked the best way with the best ingredients!!Service was amazing and the cider is a must! I definitely recommend this place!!!!
Decent, but not great. My crepe was a little overcooked and the cider was not great. They have a very reasonable lunchtime deal.
This is a great little genuine Breton creperie.  Great galettes, crepes and more.  Four of us went for lunch and really enjoyed it.
Crèpe sucre was delicious and café au lait also. Super setting and staff    Eorth waiting to find on a long walk on Saint Laurent
Terrible service - slow, indifferent, inhospitable.  Mediocre food.  So many better places - don't waste your money.

Being French and always on the lookout for good food, our national pastime, I can wholeheartedly recommend Cafe Breizh if you want a simple wholesome meal prepared with the right know-how.  The rillettes de porc were some of the best I've had on either sides of the Atlantic.   The sweet potato curry soup was also excellent, great creamy texture without letting the spices overwhelm the taste of the vegetable.  The crepe Chevrette  with goat cheese and caramelized onions was delicious except it could have been a bit saltier.  The blanquette de veau was fine, but next time I'll try a gazette for a main meal.  The killer though is the dessert crepe: run, don't walk, if you are anywhere near, and order the crepe with caramelized apples!!  So first the dough: the perfect speckled color, the texture the right elasticity, and most important, the right taste, just like my grandma.  Not too sweet.  Apples brown from cooking in butter and perfectly soft and pillowy.   Drizzled with just the right amount of caramel.   Go.  Now.
